May 2ht 1956
Mr. Paul Street, Director
NEA Centennial Celebration
National Education Association
1201 Sixteenth Street, N.W.
Washington 6, D, C,
Dear Mr. Street
Yes, indeed, we shall help the NEA observe its Centennial birth¬
day! We shall be most happy to serve as the focal point for educa*-
tional broadcasters in this regard.
In this connection, I wonder if it might be possible for you to pre¬
pare one-minute announcements that we could distribute to our members
on a considerably more varied basis than that included in your sample.
We shall also include in our Newsletter material on this Centennial
which will help all our local members to devise local ways in which
to help you observe your anniversary.
In this connection also, has any thinking been done on the possibility
which you and I never got to discuss, but which I believe Belmont
Farley and Frank Schooley talked about at some length one day? We
do want to make ourselves as useful as possible and only need the more
specific thinking which will enable us to carry on.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skomia
Executive Director
